executive_compressed_summary.statement:
POSITION AND DUTIES

Employee shall serve as Senior Software Engineer.

COMPENSATION

The Company shall pay Employee a base salary of $150,000 per year, payable in accordance with the Company's standard payroll schedule.
Employee shall be eligible for an annual performance bonus of up to 20% of base salary, subject to achievement of performance objectives.

COMPENSATION

The Company shall pay Employee a base salary of $150,000 per year, payable in accordance with the Company's standard payroll schedule.
Employee shall be eligible for an annual performance bonus of up to 20% of base salary, subject to achievement of performance objectives.

BENEFITS

Employee shall be entitled to participate in all employee benefit plans maintained by the Company, including health insurance, 401(k) retirement plan with 4% company match, and 15 days paid time off per year.
Either party may terminate this Agreement with 30 days written notice.

EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT

This Employment Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into effective January 1, 2024, between TechCorp Inc.

TERM AND TERMINATION

This Agreement shall commence on January 1, 2024 and continue until terminated by either party.
Employee shall be eligible for an annual performance bonus of up to 20% of base salary, subject to achievement of performance objectives.

numbers_and_limits.statement: Employee shall be eligible for an annual performance bonus of up to 20% of base salary, subject to achievement of performance objectives.

BENEFITS

Employee shall be entitled to participate in all employee benefit plans maintained by the Company, including health insurance, 401(k) retirement plan with 4% company match, and 15 days paid time off per year.
Either party may terminate this Agreement with 30 days written notice.
Unless terminated for cause, Employee shall receive severance pay equal to 2 months base salary.
This obligation shall survive termination and continue for a period of 5 years after termination date.

NON-COMPETE

Employee agrees not to work for direct competitors within a 50-mile radius of Company headquarters for a period of 12 months following termination.
Employee must disclose all such works within 30 days of creation.
Options vest over 4 years: 25% after first year, then monthly thereafter.

dates_and_timelines.statement:
EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT

This Employment Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into effective January 1, 2024, between TechCorp Inc.

TERM AND TERMINATION

This Agreement shall commence on January 1, 2024 and continue until terminated by either party.

exceptions_and_conditions.statement: Employee shall be eligible for an annual performance bonus of up to 20% of base salary, subject to achievement of performance objectives.
However, benefits are only available to employees who maintain active employment status.
Unless terminated for cause, Employee shall receive severance pay equal to 2 months base salary.
The Company may terminate employment immediately for cause, including but not limited to: misconduct, breach of confidentiality, or violation of company policies.
This restriction applies only if Employee is terminated without cause or resigns voluntarily.
However, the Annual Review in December carries triple weight and can override quarterly scores.
All unvested options are forfeited upon termination unless terminated without cause.

risks_and_constraints.statement:
POSITION AND DUTIES

Employee shall serve as Senior Software Engineer.

COMPENSATION

The Company shall pay Employee a base salary of $150,000 per year, payable in accordance with the Company's standard payroll schedule.
Employee shall be eligible for an annual performance bonus of up to 20% of base salary, subject to achievement of performance objectives.

BENEFITS

Employee shall be entitled to participate in all employee benefit plans maintained by the Company, including health insurance, 401(k) retirement plan with 4% company match, and 15 days paid time off per year.
The Company may terminate employment immediately for cause, including but not limited to: misconduct, breach of confidentiality, or violation of company policies.

TERM AND TERMINATION

This Agreement shall commence on January 1, 2024 and continue until terminated by either party.
Unless terminated for cause, Employee shall receive severance pay equal to 2 months base salary.
Violation of confidentiality provisions may result in legal action and damages up to $500,000.
This obligation shall survive termination and continue for a period of 5 years after termination date.

INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

All inventions, discoveries, and creative works developed during employment shall be the exclusive property of the Company.
Employee must disclose all such works within 30 days of creation.
Failure to maintain minimum threshold for two consecutive quarters may result in termination.

STOCK OPTIONS

Employee shall be granted 10,000 stock options at a strike price of $10.
No verbal agreements or modifications shall be valid.

COMPENSATION

The Company shall pay Employee a base salary of $150,000 per year, payable in accordance with the Company's standard payroll schedule.
